[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Test: verify_merge_node_config] [Merge validation bypass] Does the test at lines 314-325 cover security-critical merge scenarios, or can untested merge paths allow security bypasses in production? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Test: verify_bad_merge_node_config] [Unknown field handling] Does the test at lines 328-339 verify that ALL unknown fields are rejected, or can certain unknown field patterns bypass deny_unknown_fields validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Struct: NodeConfig] [Concurrent access] Is NodeConfig thread-safe when accessed concurrently by multiple node components, or can concurrent reads/writes during config updates cause data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: set_data_dir()] [Concurrent modification] If set_data_dir() is called while the node is running and other threads are accessing config.base.data_dir, can this cause race conditions leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: randomize_ports()] [Concurrent randomization] If randomize_ports() is called concurrently from multiple threads, can race conditions in port allocation cause multiple services to attempt binding to the same port? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: randomness_override_seq_num] [Integer overflow] Can randomness_override_seq_num at line 81 overflow if set to u64::MAX, and does on-chain code properly handle comparisons with overflowed sequence numbers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: randomness_override_seq_num] [Sequence number bypass] Can setting randomness_override_seq_num to 0 or u64::MAX cause randomness checks to be permanently bypassed, breaking consensus randomness guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Struct: NodeConfig] [Large config DoS] Can an attacker provide a config file with extremely large strings or deeply nested structures that cause excessive memory allocation during deserialization, leading to OOM crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Struct: NodeConfig] [Special character injection] Do string fields in the config properly handle special characters (null bytes, control characters, unicode) that could cause parsing errors or injection attacks in downstream components? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Struct: NodeConfig] [Enum variant confusion] Can serde deserialization of enum fields in sub-configs be exploited to deserialize to unexpected enum variants that bypass validation logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: load_from_path()] [Symbolic link exploitation] Does load_from_path() resolve symbolic links before loading, or can symlink attacks redirect config loading to attacker-controlled files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: save_to_path()] [File permission issues] Does save_to_path() set restrictive file permissions (0600) on saved configs to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive configuration data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: save_to_path()] [Disk space exhaustion] Does save_to_path() check available disk space before writing large configs, or can attackers cause disk exhaustion by triggering repeated config saves? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: get_primary_network_config()] [Network priority manipulation] At lines 160-168, can the order of full_node_networks be manipulated so that a malicious network config is selected instead of the legitimate Public network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: validator_network] [Validator network isolation] Can validator_network at line 89 be configured to listen on public interfaces, exposing the validator network to unauthorized peers and potential DoS attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: full_node_networks] [Duplicate network IDs] Can multiple entries in full_node_networks have the same network_id, causing network routing confusion and message delivery failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: get_identity_key()] [Key derivation] Does the identity key returned by get_identity_key() come from a secure key derivation function, or can predictable key generation lead to key collisions across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: generate_random_config_with_template()] [RNG seeding] Does the StdRng used in generate_random_config_with_template() get properly seeded with entropy, or can weak seeding lead to predictable validator keys in production? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: generate_random_config_with_template()] [Key material cleanup] After generating random configs with private keys at lines 224-226, are the keys properly zeroized from memory, or can they leak through memory dumps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: randomness_override_seq_num] [Randomness recovery attack] Can validators coordinate to set randomness_override_seq_num values that allow them to re-enable randomness at a specific future epoch, enabling coordinated attacks on randomness-dependent features? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Field: randomness_override_seq_num] [Denial of randomness] If an attacker compromises < 1/3 validators and sets different randomness_override_seq_num values on each, can this permanently disable randomness without possibility of recovery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: save_to_path()] [Config export sanitization] Does save_to_path() sanitize sensitive fields before writing to disk, or can exported configs leak private keys, API tokens, and other secrets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: load_from_path()] [Config versioning] Does load_from_path() validate config file versions to prevent loading incompatible old configs that might bypass new security features? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: merge_node_config()] [Malicious override injection] Can an attacker inject a malicious override_node_config that exploits serde_merge vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code during merge operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config.rs] [Function: set_data_dir()] [Partial update atomicity] If set_data_dir() fails partway through (e.g., consensus.set_data_dir() succeeds but storage.set_data_dir() fails), does it rollback changes or leave configs in inconsistent state? (High)
